Subject: TT NYC | Crazy conceptual art + food
TextBody:
TastingTable New York City
Weekend Menu



Thursday, 5/23 7:30 to 10:30 p.m., $45
Walk It Out
Elastic City, an art organization featuring walks by artists, hosts a 
spring benefit tonight. In addition to such activities as a silent auction, 
drawings by a New Yorker cartoonist and a twist on a photo booth, enjoy 
Moroccan food, desserts from BabyCakes, and cocktails from a Death & Co. 
bartender (see details and purchase tickets here
<http://elasticcity.brownpapertickets.com/> ). EFA Project Space, 323 W. 
39th St. (between Eighth & Ninth aves.); elastic-city.org
<http://www.elastic-city.org/blog/elastic-city-spring-benefit>

SPONSORED
 

It's your lucky day! Tequila Don Julio
<http://www.tastingtable.com/sf/sweepstakes.htm?sweepstakesID=326> is 
offering you a chance to win two tickets
<http://www.tastingtable.com/sf/sweepstakes.htm?sweepstakesID=326> to the 
sold-out Tasting Table Lobster Roll Rumble. You'll taste your way through 
20 rolls as they duke it out for the title of America's Best Lobster Roll, 
enjoy savory sides, and end the night with gelato. Don't miss out--enter 
now <http://www.tastingtable.com/sf/sweepstakes.htm?sweepstakesID=326> !

Sunday, 5/26 2 to 10 p.m., $15, or $25 VIP
Get Outside
Take advantage of a sunny long weekend at Do or Dine's
<http://www.tastingtable.com/entry_detail/nyc/4235/Do_or_Dine_a_new_comedy_coming_to_dinners_near_you.htm> 
backyard party on Sunday. The much-hyped Brooklyn restaurant will offer 
food and music all afternoon at its outdoor "Dub a Grub" event, which will 
feature a DJ from A Tribe Called Quest (purchase tickets here
<http://rubagrubspring.brownpapertickets.com/> ). Do or Dine, 1108 Bedford 
Ave. (at Union St.), Brooklyn; 718-684-2290 or facebook.com/doordine
<https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10151361257805064&set=oa.495035533901457&type=1&theater>

Tuesday, 5/28 6:30 p.m., $30
Farm Fare
Urban farming is taking on new meanings as New Yorkers plant rooftops, 
warehouses, gardens and more. Hear more about the trend at this roundtable 
talk by urban agriculture experts, followed by live bluegrass music and, of 
course, farm-to-table eats (purchase tickets here
<https://webformsrig01bo3.blackbaudhosting.com/10819/tickets?tab=2&txobjid=89b7bd07-8eb3-4b90-a9f1-01c41c1acf72> 
). Tenement Museum, 103 Orchard St. (at Delancey St.); 212-928-8420 or 
tenement.org
<http://tenement.org/culinary_conversations_details.php?id=8#.UZvrG4IUunw>

Saturday, 6/1 7 to 9:30 p.m., $135
Heads Up!
Head uptown to taste the best of the neighborhood at the annual New Taste 
of the Upper West Side event. Saturday's party, Best of the West 2013, 
features food from Ditch Plains, Picholine, Red Farm, Shake Shack, Boulud 
Sud and many more. Food & Wine's Gail Simmons
<http://www.tastingtable.com/entry_detail/national/13146/The_Top_Chef_judge_tells_us_her_tips_for_delicious_travel.htm> 
hosts the soir?e (purchase tickets here
<http://newtasteuws.com/tickets.html> ). Columbus Ave. between W. 76th & W. 
77th sts.; newtasteuws.com <http://newtasteuws.com/>



------------------------

HtmlBody:
Backyard parties and upscale tastings
Thursday, 5/23, 7:30 to 10:30 p.m., $45
Walk It Out

Elastic City, an art organization featuring walks by artists, hosts a spring benefit tonight. In addition to such activities as a silent auction, drawings by a New Yorker cartoonist and a twist on a photo booth, enjoy Moroccan food, desserts from BabyCakes, and cocktails from a Death & Co. bartender (see details and purchase tickets here). EFA Project Space, 323 W. 39th St. (between Eighth & Ninth aves.); elastic-city.org

Buy Tickets
Thursday, 6/6, 7 to 10 p.m.
Elevate Your Summer with 2 Tickets to Tasting Table's Lobster Roll Rumble!

It's your lucky day! Tequila Don Julio is offering you a chance to win two tickets to the sold-out Tasting Table Lobster Roll Rumble. You'll taste your way through 20 rolls as they duke it out for the title of America's Best Lobster Roll, enjoy savory sides, and end the night with gelato. Don't miss out--enter now!

Enter to win two tickets to the Rumble
Sunday, 5/26, 2 to 10 p.m., $15, or $25 VIP
Get Outside

Take advantage of a sunny long weekend at Do or Dine’s backyard party on Sunday. The much-hyped Brooklyn restaurant will offer food and music all afternoon at its outdoor “Dub a Grub” event, which will feature a DJ from A Tribe Called Quest (purchase tickets here). Do or Dine, 1108 Bedford Ave. (at Union St.), Brooklyn; 718-684-2290 or facebook.com/doordine

Buy Tickets
Tuesday, 5/28, 6:30 p.m., $30
Farm Fare

Urban farming is taking on new meanings as New Yorkers plant rooftops, warehouses, gardens and more. Hear more about the trend at this roundtable talk by urban agriculture experts, followed by live bluegrass music and, of course, farm-to-table eats (purchase tickets here). Tenement Museum, 103 Orchard St. (at Delancey St.); 212-928-8420 or tenement.org

Buy Tickets
Saturday, 6/1, 7 to 9:30 p.m., $135
Heads Up!

Head uptown to taste the best of the neighborhood at the annual New Taste of the Upper West Side event. Saturday’s party, Best of the West 2013, features food from Ditch Plains, Picholine, Red Farm, Shake Shack, Boulud Sud and many more. Food & Wine’s Gail Simmons hosts the soirée (purchase tickets here). Columbus Ave. between W. 76th & W. 77th sts.; newtasteuws.com

Buy Tickets
To a Friend   This Article
To Tasting Table   A Friend to
Tasting Table
 
 
 
Watermark Bar
This breezy bar, located on Pier 15 at the South Street Seaport, open today. Beer, Margaritas, burgers and boozy snow cones are all available to enjoy in deck chairs that face the river.
Battery Harris
Today is opening day for this craft beer and cocktail bar in Williamsburg. It sports a large courtyard and a menu of jerk chicken, coconut corn bread and baked patties. See the cocktail, food and beer menus.
Fish & Game
Field trip! Chef Zakary Pelaccio has opened this restaurant in Hudson, New York (approximately 2 hours from NYC). The menu celebrates New York-grown foods and utilizes fish sauce, vermouth, vinegars and kimchis--which are all made in-house.
